content.raw:
I feel like I'm missing something important, maybe a verbal chat will help. If we don't touch base today, I'm still curious as to why the Factory class is needed. The Factory class only defines a few convenience functions that in turn wrap a sequence of ECM function calls. It seems easier to define the convenience function wrappers in the ECM class itself.

Taking the UserCommands system example, instead of creating a Factory object you could directly call ECM functions.
content.html:
I feel like I'm missing something important, maybe a verbal chat will help. If we don't touch base today, I'm still curious as to why the Factory class is needed. The Factory class only defines a few convenience functions that in turn wrap a sequence of ECM function calls. It seems easier to define the convenience function wrappers in the ECM class itself.

Taking the UserCommands system example, instead of creating a Factory object you could directly call ECM functions.
